intro: Valeriana rufescens, commonly known as red valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their sedative and calming properties. Valeriana rufescens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
